rationale: The agent's solution correctly addresses the core task: fixing the CI script to ignore non-transport changes when auto-committing. Both the ground truth and agent's solution modify the key git diff check at line 33-34 to focus on the transport directory. The agent goes further by: (1) introducing a TRANSPORT_STATE_PATH variable for DRY principles, (2) applying the same scoping to the pre-check at lines 9-11, (3) scoping the git add command to only stage transport files, and (4) updating git status to show only relevant files. The ground truth uses --quiet flag while the agent uses --exit-code (both achieve the same result). The agent's additional changes (pre-check scoping, scoped git add) are beneficial and more thorough in preventing non-transport files from being committed, though not strictly required by the minimal task description. There's one unnecessary blank line added (line 34), a minor style issue. No unsolicited documentation was added. Overall, the agent's solution is more comprehensive and robust than the ground truth, addressing the spirit of the task more completely.
ground_truth_patch:
diff --git a/.buildkite/scripts/update-transport-versions.sh b/.buildkite/scripts/update-transport-versions.sh
index c3ae067f9ce..e18c85c72b7 100755
--- a/.buildkite/scripts/update-transport-versions.sh
+++ b/.buildkite/scripts/update-transport-versions.sh
@@ -31,8 +31,8 @@ fi
 
 .ci/scripts/run-gradle.sh generateTransportVersion --backport-branches="${backport_branches}"
 
-if git diff --exit-code; then
-  echo "No changes found after updating transport versions. Don't need to auto commit."
+if git diff --quiet -- "server/src/main/resources/transport/**"; then
+  echo "No transport version changes found after update. Skipping auto commit."
   exit 0
 fi
